<doc> Releasing with HZ

== Description ==

This tutorial shows how to release a HOP weblet with the HOP distribution
system, namely ,(<A> :href "http://localhost:8080/hop/hz"
      (<SPAN> :style {font-variant: small-caps} "Hz")).

~~ A ,(<A> :href "http://localhost:8080/hop/hz"
      (<SPAN> :style {font-variant: small-caps} "Hz")) package is actually
a tarball file (a [[http://www.gnu.org/software/gzip/gzip.html|gzipped]] tar 
file) containing the source code of the weblet
plus some utility files and some contribution files (e.g., icons needed
by your application).

== Requirements ==

In order to build HOP ++.hz++ file, you need:

  - an operational HOP.
  - the GNU [[http://www.gnu.org/software/tar/|tar]] utility.


Let's assume a weblet named ++foo++. The package ++foo.hz++ must contain:

  - ++foo.hop++: The source file that contains the definition of the 
 ,(<APIREF> "service" "service.wiki") ++foo++.
  - optional additional ++.hop++ files, ++.hss++, and ++.css++ files.
  - ++.afile++: this file is needed if the weblet uses several source files.
  - ++etc/foo.info++: this file contains meta information on the package
 (e.g., the revision number, the author, etc.).
  - ++etc/logo.png++: the logo (a 48x48 image) of the weblet.
